alert.note: Alert for Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 6:14PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Red Willow County through 645 PM CDT... At 612 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles east of McCook, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...McCook Airport gusted to 59 mph at 6:03pm CT. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of Red Willow County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Goodland. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for northwestern Kansas...and southwestern Nebraska.
